Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with handle root; interior: glazed streaky brownish-black (mostly worn at top of sherd); exterior: surface very worn; from top, trace of tongue pattern (with some added red); at right of handle root, black-figure quiver; below, trace of brown band
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as Louvre AM1360 (14) and AM1360 (1).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.172) (phase 3)
